New Haven Paint & Clay Club 111th Annual Juried Art Exhibit

 

Annual Juried Art Exhibition is a big undertaking by the Club. Any artist living in New England or New York can submit one or two works to this show for a fee. Usually the Club receives nearly 500 entries to this show. A museum curator or artist not associated with the Club is asked to narrow these entries to only 100-110 pieces. That same juror is asked to select works for the over $4000 cash awards which the Club and community organizations offer for this show.

The Club officers select works to be added to the Permanent Collection from each of these exhibits. Typically two to four works are added to the Collection each year.

The New Haven Paint & Clay Club

In 1900, a group of Connecticut artists gathered

“... for the purpose of organizing a society or club to hold
exhibitions of paintings, drawings and sculpture by
members of the proposed society ...”

and founded The New Haven Paint & Clay Club. This was the beginning of one of New England’s oldest, and still active, arts organizations.

The purpose of the New Haven Paint & Clay Club is still to provide opportunities for artists to show their work. The Club sponsors two exhibits each year for the enjoyment and education of the public.
